urls.title: Transforming the Trent Valley
urls.description: The Washlands is an extensive piece of natural land that follows the river through to the heart of Burton upon Trent. The vision, informed by consultation with key stakeholders and the local community, addresses how to best balance the regular flooding of the area with the need for public access and recreation, whilst promoting nature conservation and a more environmentally sustainable approach to green space management. Through our natural heritage project, known as Living Floodplains, we will help to

tweets.text:
*** FLOOD ALERT ***

The Environment Agency @EnvAgencyNW have issued a 'Flooding is possible - be prepared' amber alert which includes areas within Tameside. Please check alerts and take care. 

More details here:

https://t.co/txKTHfBfAx

urls.description: Check your risk of flooding: get current flood warnings, river and sea levels, check the 5-day forecast or use flood risk maps

tweets.text:
Stay #floodaware and check @EnvAgencyNW flood alerts and warnings here: https://t.co/wOdEaTYcDu

#StormBella #flooding

Our teams have been out today preparing for heavy rainfall overnight. This photo shows 'stop logs' in place in Mytholmroyd to help reduce flood risk. Check your flood risk at: https://t.co/OVBXgMyngb #floodaware https://t.co/pNBlpUVz1Q

There are 7 flood alerts in place across the North West in Cheshire, Greater Manchester and Cumbria. For advice on #flooding visit: https://t.co/0qnkCYntKb

#Carlisle #Appleby #Bury #Radcliffe #Rochdale #Bolton #Stockport #Chester https://t.co/zsfiZTUOoZ

#TeamEA will issue flood alerts and warnings where needed this evening as #stormbella brings wind and rain to the #northwest. 

For the latest visit https://t.co/uGQ4g6A5Xn

#beprepared #prepareactsurvive

7pm, #BoxingDay 

If you follow our maps, you'll see fewer alerts/warnings in the #ThamesValley than earlier today... but we still urge caution and care in some areas...

...and we now have alerts in place in #Kent and #Sussex: https://t.co/fxAIt7dpdx or 0345 988 1188 #StormBella https://t.co/JlCxkaC7Xc

Do read this, it shows what it's like to leave your home ( because of imminent #floods) in a hurry.

Britain braces for storm Bella as homes evacuated in north Bedfordshire https://t.co/Vfv4KKDszj

tweets.text: #StormBella will bring strong winds to our coastline tonight. Although the highest waves are predicted to be overnight, rogue waves can occur at any time in windy conditions. Stay safe, don't wave watch and stay back from quaysides, the water‚Äôs edge and beaches. https://t.co/9Z6IyCJCZq

Thank Stewart excellent job @EnvAgencyNW do.

Likewise @LancasterCC haven't been taking any chances. 

Out this afternoon and evening sweeping channels in flood prone areas. https://t.co/mrKlLx0tpa https://t.co/4VGwKR4rO3

tweets.text: #StormBella sounding wild outside but talking with the @EnvAgencyNW duty team we are only anticipating a handful of alerts overnight for #cumbria #Lancashire and these are starting to go on - keep up to date üëâ https://t.co/U7kgP2AgP5 https://t.co/38VfaCHAv8

@thamesmobo @EnvAgencySE Last few times the Jubilee has been used, I think the threshold was 170 cu metres/sec at Maidenhead. So I wouldn't have expected its use yet. Of course there may be different procedures for the current situation

We've had a lot of rain in Oxford over the last few days resulting in @EnvAgency flood warnings in Oxford. The difference between the 22nd and 26th of December is in this pair of Sentinel 1 VV polarisation images picked from the @sentinel_hub Sentinel Playground is pretty stark! https://t.co/VyZJVJTqPh

tweets.text: Our team is out in #SouthHinksey #Oxford erecting a temporary flood barrier¬†to protect properties from flooding. River levels have risen¬†fast following heavy rainfall. Further rainfall is expected¬†on Saturday and Sunday with #Storm Bella.¬†Please stay #FloodAware.¬†1/2
